doc.field: Luella H. Brock New York viewbook
Luella H. Brock New York viewbook

The Luella H. Brock New York viewbook contains black-and-white illustrations showing views of New York City, circa 1900. The views are primarily of locations in Manhattan, though there are two images relating to Brooklyn; a view the Brooklyn Bridge and a view from the Brooklyn tower of the Brooklyn Bridge.

The Luella H. Brock New York viewbook contains black-and-white illustrations showing views of New York City, circa 1900. The views are primarily of locations in Manhattan, though there are two images relating to Brooklyn; a view the Brooklyn Bridge and a view from the Brooklyn tower of the Brooklyn Bridge.
Viewbooks, also called souvenir albums or view albums, are books that contain commercially published groups of photographs depicting a place, activity, or event.
Gift of Luella H. Brock, date unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1991.
